png

Class ChunkHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • png.ChunkHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageHandler

    public class ChunkHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImageHandler
    Handles the processing and collection of metadata-related chunks from a PNG image file.

    This handler processes PNG chunks such as:

    • tEXt, iTXt, zTXt – textual metadata chunks
    • eXIf – embedded EXIF metadata (in TIFF format)

    This class is typically used during PNG metadata parsing and delegates specific parsing responsibilities to appropriate chunk or Exif handlers.

    Note: In Windows Explorer, the Date Taken attribute is often resolved from the Creation Time textual keyword rather than the embedded EXIF block. This behaviour can affect the chronological ordering of PNG files when viewed or processed on Windows systems.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChunkHandler

        public ChunkHandler(java.nio.file.Path fpath,
                    ImageFileInputStream reader,
                    java.util.EnumSet<ChunkType> requiredChunks)
        Constructs a handler to parse selected chunks from a PNG image file, assuming the read mode is not strict.
        Parameters:
        fpath - the path to the PNG file for logging purposes
        reader - byte reader for raw PNG stream
        requiredChunks - an optional set of chunk types to be extracted (null means all chunks are selected)

      • ChunkHandler

        public ChunkHandler(java.nio.file.Path fpath,
                    ImageFileInputStream reader,
                    java.util.EnumSet<ChunkType> requiredChunks,
                    boolean strict)
        Constructs a handler to parse selected chunks from a PNG image file.
        Parameters:
        fpath - the path to the PNG file for logging purposes
        reader - byte reader for raw PNG stream
        requiredChunks - an optional set of chunk types to be extracted (null means all chunks are selected)
        strict - true to make it strict, otherwise false for a lenient reading process

    • Method Detail

      • getChunks

        public java.util.List<PngChunk> getChunks()
        Retrieves a list of chunks that have been extracted.
        Returns:
        an unmodified list of chunks

      • getTextualData

        public java.util.Optional<java.util.List<PngChunk>> getTextualData()
        Retrieves all textual metadata chunks from the PNG file as an unmodifiable list.

        Textual metadata includes tEXt, iTXt, and zTXt chunks, which store key-value text pairs or compressed textual information.

        Returns:
        an Optional containing a list of textual PngChunk objects if found, or Optional.empty() if no textual chunks are present

      • getExifData

        public java.util.Optional<byte[]> getExifData()
                                       throws ImageReadErrorException
        Retrieves the embedded EXIF data from the PNG file, if present.

        The EXIF metadata is stored in the eXIf chunk as raw TIFF-formatted data. If the PNG file contains an eXIf chunk, its byte array is returned wrapped in Optional. If no eXIf chunk exists, Optional.empty() is returned.

        Returns:
        an Optional containing the EXIF data as a byte array if found, or Optional.empty() if absent
        Throws:
        ImageReadErrorException - if multiple chunks, that are disallowed, are detected

      • existsChunk

        public boolean existsChunk(ChunkType type)
        Checks if a chunk with the specified type has already been set.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the chunk
        Returns:
        true if the chunk is already present

      • getSafeFileSize

        public long getSafeFileSize()
        Returns the size of the image file being processed, in bytes.

        Any IOException that occurs while determining the size will be handled internally, and the method will return 0 if the size cannot be determined.

        Specified by:
        getSafeFileSize in interface ImageHandler
        Returns:
        the file size in bytes, or 0 if it cannot be determined

      • parseMetadata

        public boolean parseMetadata()
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             ImageReadErrorException
        Begins metadata processing by parsing the PNG file and extracting chunk data. It also checks if the PNG file contains the expected magic numbers in the first few bytes in the file stream. If these numbers actually exist, they will then be skipped.
        Specified by:
        parseMetadata in interface ImageHandler
        Returns:
        true if at least one chunk element was successfully extracted, or false if no relevant data was found
        Throws:
        ImageReadErrorException - if an error occurs while parsing the PNG file
        java.io.IOException - if there is an I/O stream error

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a textual representation of all parsed PNG chunks in this file.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        formatted string of all parsed chunk entries

      • parseChunks

        private void parseChunks()
                  throws ImageReadErrorException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Processes the PNG data stream and extracts matching chunk types into memory.
        Throws:
        ImageReadErrorException - if invalid structure or duplicate chunks are found, including a CRC calculation mismatch error
        java.io.IOException - if there is an I/O stream error

      • addChunk

        private PngChunk addChunk(ChunkType chunkType,
                          long length,
                          byte[] typeBytes,
                          int crc32,
                          byte[] data)
        Adds a parsed chunk to the internal chunk collection. Special types such as iTXt, zTXt, and tEXt are instantiated into specific subclasses.
        Parameters:
        chunkType - the type of PNG chunk
        length - the data length of the chunk
        typeBytes - the raw 4-byte chunk type for CRC calculation
        crc32 - the CRC value read from the file
        data - raw chunk data
        Returns:
        a populated PngChunk instance
